results.content:
This is my 19th Udemy course and the first coding one I have ever finished.  In all of the others, I would have some sort of issue that the instructor would either ignore in the Q&A or would respond with something along the lines of "just copy my code."  This was always frustrating because I actually teach high school computer programming at the AP level, so it's not as if I'm a complete beginner.

In this course, Reece was absolutely fantastic.  I've been a classroom teacher for 36 years and know what good teaching looks like; this guy is the real thing.  He is clear, concise, and encouraging and responded to my one question with 24 hours!

Thanks to Reece, I now have a terrific portfolio website that I understand completely and can therefore modify at will.  I wish I could give this course more than five stars!

results.content:
Quite a worthwhile project course.  It does a good job of showing you how to merge what you know of HTML, CSS and Javascript into a nice resume page. And in fact the code you end up with could easily be used as a framework for a number of additional projects...product pages etc.

Of particular value was the introduction of a number of JS and CSS plugins that make adding some relatively advanced looking effects to your page simple.  

Be aware, it's not a course designed to teach you HTML/CSS/Javascript.  If you don't already have some background in those technologies you'll probably just be typing along with no real understanding of why you're typing what you're typing.  But if you already have those basics, this course is a good next step.

results.content:
Reece Kenney is a great instructor.
 
I like to buy longer courses if possible. This 4 hours could easily go into 7 or 8 hours.  But Reece Kenney goes straight to the point, he does not speak random things; he is fast and his choice of words are perfect. 

And because of it even if he goes fast it is still easy to understand. You can always pause or go back 15 seconds if needed.

This course teaches you how to implement third-party tools which is important. It shows you how to add Bootstrap, jQuery, how to write good code, where to find icons, images, and so on. 

But you need to check things on your own if you want to learn more.
He does not spend a lot of time showing you each of the plugins he puts into his portfolio project. And that is not a bad thing.

Still, I think this course is not for a total beginner. It is not the right course to start with. 
Reece says in the description: "Basic HTML knowledge is nice to have but not needed".
From my point of view, you should already know HTML, CSS and maybe be familiar with some CSS framework to benefit the most. You should also know what is JavaScript and what is it used for.

I like to enroll in courses, and I know that this one is good and deserves 4.5 or 5 stars. I am already interested in other Reece courses.

So yes, I would recommend it to a friend.

results.content:
I've been coding for many years now, but never with Java nor for web development, and I can tell that coding can sometimes be hard to understand. The course has a very quick pace, but I personally prefer that. Very well structured and intuitive. Reece explains each step very carefully, and gives you enough details to allow you to tune the style of your website when your done (it's not just about copying and pasting his code). He's also very responsive if you post on the forum. I personally prefer this course to these online 'build your own website' platform that use templates that everybody is using.

The only critic I would have is that it's missing one final video explaining how to put your website only (how and where to buy a domain, how and where to get a web hosting package, how to put your content on your website, etc.). I struggled a bit with this part, and I think a video on the topic would make the course complete!

results.content: While I couldn't recommend this course to anyone who's brand new to web development, it's an excellent run through of building a professional website for those with previous knowledge who want a good starting point to build upon. There are plenty of useful plugins recommended that make the process smooth and add additional flair to the website. I intend to improve/change the website I've created to make it more my own, but the results from completing this course are already fantastic and more than I could achieve given a blank HTML document. The course is short and doesn't dwell on the specifics of each line of code, and the materials are presented in easy to follow fashion! Once I've uploaded my website to the web I'll be sure to update this review so you can see the kind of product that you can expect to build using this course.
results.content_html: While I couldn't recommend this course to anyone who's brand new to web development, it's an excellent run through of building a professional website for those with previous knowledge who want a good starting point to build upon. There are plenty of useful plugins recommended that make the process smooth and add additional flair to the website. I intend to improve/change the website I've created to make it more my own, but the results from completing this course are already fantastic and more than I could achieve given a blank HTML document. The course is short and doesn't dwell on the specifics of each line of code, and the materials are presented in easy to follow fashion! Once I've uploaded my website to the web I'll be sure to update this review so you can see the kind of product that you can expect to build using this course.

results.content:
The course is tremendously valuable for applying all the theory ( HTML / CSS / javaScript / CSS Grid frameworks ) that someone like myself has and put it in real perspective.  From that perspective, this course deserves a 5 star rating .. 

However, I took off 1/2 star from my rating  only because the description of this course welcomes total newbies in the above technologies and it will be easy for newcomers without prior experience to totally feel "lost" when they copy code that doesn't make sense 100% ( like positioning relative vs. absolute ) using the Bootstrap column grid system and acronyms such as col-md.. -xs .. -sm ..  ( medium devices, extra-small devices, small devices ) etc .. So for people like myself who has spent time reading a lot (but not practicing as much as I should ) this course is "Golden" .. but for a total newbie it can be a bit hard to follow at times.

Updating to a 5 star rating as Reece has proven again and again a solid instructor, a great mentor when you need help, and I find his material a great reference to re-visit and "seal" the knowledge on some key points for good.

results.content:
Here are the things I enjoyed about this course.
1.  Reece responded almost immediately after I wrote him a short note.  This lets me know several things about the instructor.  They read their messages and then take the time to give a response.  The automated note at the beginning when you sign up is not personal and very typical.  But where the rubber meets the road is when an instructor shows interest and writes you back.

2.  Yes, this course teaches how to build a portfolio site but there is a lot under the hood.  Reece brings great plugins for example "icons8" and others that I haven't used to date.  Then he does a great job in explaining why and how to use each of them.

3.  The course design is well thought out and the pace is easy to follow.  I like that in every section Reece gives resource files so that the student can check his work against the teachers source code.  I'm still learning  JavaScript so at times it was better for me to copy and paste but that option worked great.

4.  At the end I was able to customize my site and was extremely pleased on how it looked and how each of the specific elements worked.  For example toward the end you will add a "pre-loader."  Well that along with the other plug-ins work as advertised.  

5.  I've spent lots of time with Udemy courses over the last few years.  And based on my experience I give this particular course my highest recommendation.

results.content: As a person who is coming on up in his third year of working in the industry, being out of college since 2015, I have redone my portfolio over a hundred times (or at least it feels like that) and I never found the one that fit me as a developer. With this course, I finally found one fits me as a developer and one that I would be proud to show off once I add a bit more content. Reese's course was so simple and educational that the second I finished the exercises, I was already planning on adding a timeline of my career using jquery and a couple of other features (aka social media icons in the footer). Overall he did an amazing job if I have the time I'm buying his other course, the Spotify clone. I love working with SQL and PHP which are my favorite languages to code. GREAT JOB!!!!

results.content:
I have little experience with HTML/CSS/Javascript/jQuery/Bootstrap.
If you have basic understanding of those above, this course definitely brushes up your skills up to next level. Plus, your own portfolio for future uses!
I emphasize "basic understanding" part because if you have no idea what HTML/CSS/Javascript are.. It's hard to imagine what you would gain from this course other than watch him coding. You type exactly the same thing and Boom! make website work. But do you know why it works that way? When you see $("h1") , do you read it as document.querySelector("h1")?
Yes this is for beginner but I highly suggest that you go learn some very basics and take this course. You will like this course even more!
Reece introduces lots of cool plug-ins and websites for resources. That part was especially fun and helpful for me. I bought 2 more of his lectures after this. Excited!
